meanings.definition: The act of moving a paddle through water to propel a boat.
meanings.sent1: During our canoe trip, the smooth paddlings helped us glide across the lake.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her paddlings technique to steer the kayak efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized paddlings of the rowing team impressed the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic paddlings of the dragon boat team echoed across the lake.
meanings.sent5: The instructor demonstrated the correct paddlings form to the beginners.

meanings.definition: A physical punishment involving hitting someone with a paddle.
meanings.sent1: In some schools, paddlings were used as a form of discipline in the past.
meanings.sent2: The principal decided to ban paddlings as a punishment due to its controversial nature.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student joked that he deserved double paddlings for his prank.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden paddle used for paddlings had seen better days.
meanings.sent5: The threat of paddlings kept the students in line during the canoe trip.

meanings.definition: The sound of splashing water made by paddles.
meanings.sent1: The soothing paddlings of the oars created a calming rhythm on the lake.
meanings.sent2: As the canoe glided through the water, the paddlings created a symphony of splashes.
meanings.sent3: The playful otters mimicked the paddlings of the passing kayakers.
meanings.sent4: The midnight paddlings of the rowers under the moonlight were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The sudden paddlings interrupted the peaceful silence of the lake.
